medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until several months prior to admission when an intermittent, nonproductive cough developed. Ten days before admission, she experienced left-sided subscapular pain after raking leaves, which migrated to below the left breast. The next day, she had sudden, severe pleuritic pain below the left breast accompanied by dizziness and sweating, but without dyspnea or loss of consciousness. Subsequent episodes included pleuritic pain with dyspnea and profound weakness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Polymyalgia rheumatica diagnosed one year before admission and resolved with prednisone therapy; hysterectomy performed many years before admission due to leiomyomas.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents and a sister had phlebitis. The father had an intracranial blood clot and died of prostatic carcinoma at 98 years old.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a retired nurse and had never smoked.
